intro: Labourdonnaisia albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered laburnum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a silky, white coating. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
